The secretary to the Hon 1 ble the Political Residei^w in the persian c^ulf, B'u.shire. Sir, With reference to Article 85 of the Kuwait orderr-in-Council, 1925, I have the honour to submit herewith my report on the working of the KUwait Order-in-Council, 1925, for the period from 1st January to 51st December 1928. A criminal case Rex vs Mft , autoah daughter of Ibrahim, was tried on the lat of April under'section 30? of the Indian penal code for attempting to poison her husband, BiHu son of Husain Baldash. The accused was found guilty by the Sessions judge at Kuwait and was sentenced on the 23rd of April 1928 to three years simple imprisonment. The finding was reversed, however, by the Chief Court, Bushire, who acquitted the accused under section 423 of the Criminal procedure Code and ordered her release on the 18th May 1928. Thirty seven British subjects and four British protected persons were registered during the year 1928.• rour of these Yvere registered free and a sum of Es 37/— was collected lor the remainder. CIVIL CASES. No Civil cases were tried during the year 1928. CRIMINAL CASES. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 18/110 (B Series 18/12) Annual Report on the Working of the Kuwait Order in Council'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation system in use runs from the front cover to the back cover, and appears written in pencil, enclosed in a circle, in the top right hand corner of the recto page of each folio. Foliation anomalies: f.1 is followed by ff.2A, 2B.

mods.abstract: Annual Reports of the Political Agent, Kuwait to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf on the working of The Kuwait Order in Council, 1925(later The Kuwait Order in Council, 1935). The Reports cover the period 1 October 1925 (when the Order came into force) to 31 December 1925, and the years 1926-1947 inclusive. The information in the Reports comes under the headings of civil cases, criminal cases, and registration of British subjects and British protected persons.
